column4: Hi, I have just compiled git (with make) and it created lots of git related directories into my home (e.g. bin, lib, libexec, share and each includes git related files)  Do I have to run 'make' with a prefix to avoid this mess? Why didn't it keep everything in the /usr/local/src as expected?
The idea is to commpile it in to a debian package
why compile git?  It's in the repositorise
I was just feeling I could do it. ;) I was wrong
